turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Plarail.
turn.2: Plarail  , pronounced in English as "Play rail" is a toy train and plastic track system made by Tomy and introduced in Japan in 1959.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It was expanded into a battery-operated electric toy train system in October 1961. Plarail is not compatible with most other brands of model railway, although as it has a similar rail gauge to the wooden toy train systems, rolling stock may run on both systems to some degree.
turn.6: In 1959, the Plarail system launched in Japan with three hand-powered trains.
turn.8: The first train set released was titled 'Plastic Railroad Set', which featured a plastic steam train and three freight wagons to be moved by hand, and a figure 8 of light blue plastic railway track.
turn.9: Was there anything else different about it?
turn.10: In October 1961, the range was expanded into a battery-operated electric toy train system, where the trains were fitted with miniature motors.
turn.12: The first set featuring this was the 'Electric Pla-Train Set', which included a three-car configuration of an engine and two wagons.
